name: iafd
description: Scrapes scene data from the Internet Adult Film Database (iafd). Supports single-scene and multi-scene titles (movies)

arguments.name: whitelist
arguments.description: Array of data fields to pick (possible values: 'description, actors, studio, releaseDate, labels

arguments.name: blacklist
arguments.description: Array of data fields to omit (for values see whitelist)

arguments.name: addMovieNameInSceneName
arguments.description: For multi-scene titles (movies), IAFD simply names the scene: 'Scene 1', 'Scene 2',... This does not make for very good scene names. When this argument is true, the scene name will be a concatenation of the movie name and the short scene name. Example: 'Best Movie Ever - Scene 1'.

arguments.name: keepInitialSceneNameForMovies
arguments.description: Only relevant for multi-scene titles like movie, where IAFD does not have names for every scenes (scene 1, scene 2,...). Wether to keep porn-vault's initial scene name or replace it wih the IAFD simple names.

arguments.name: sceneIndexMatchingRegex
arguments.description: Regex used to identify the scene index in the scene name (matched with the case insensitive flag). The default regex will match patterns with 'Scene' and a number or 'S' and a number (Scene1, Scene 02, S01, s1,...). Advanced setting. Leave the default unless you know what you are doing. In you provide a custom regex, make sure you have one regex group called 'index' that isolates/matches the scene index number (and nothing else).
